availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Edmond Gray (Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer and sailor. Kentucky native. Married to Mary America Richardson Gray on April 10, 1846 in Cincinnati, Ohio. Father of Jesse Gray, Mary Gray, Thomas G. Gray, Sarah M. Gray, and Mariah E. Gray. Farmer in Bracken County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bracken County in 1860. Served in the U.S. Navy as a seaman from November 26, 1863 to June 4, 1864. Served aboard the U.S.S. Tyler. Discharged due to medical disability on June 4, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 430B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District No. 1, p. 239.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Foster, p. 348B.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Civil War and Later Navy Veterans ("Navy Survivor's Certificates"), 1861-1910, M1469, Roll 27340.
Hospital Tickets and Case Papers, compiled 1825-1889. ARC ID: 2694723. Department of the Navy, Records of the Bureau of Medicine and Surgery, Record Group 52. National Archives at Washington, D.C., Form G, p. 26.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #8340.
United States, Naval Enlistment Rendezvous, 1855-1891, NARA microfilm publication M1953. Washington D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, Cincinnati, OH, November 28, 1863, p. 690.
"William Edmond Gray (1826-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46717863, accessed August 22, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46717863.
